German: Du bist aber ganz schön spät dran, oder?

English:
No, no, it's fine.
It's not like there's been any real movement here.
Chinese:
不，我不介意喔！
我這裡也沒有什麼特別的動靜。
Korean:
아니아니 상관없어
이쪽에는 특별히 눈에 띄는 행동은 없었으니까 말이지
German:
Nein, ist schon in Ordnung.
Hier hat sich nicht viel getan.

Wie?
Es hat sich etwas getan?

English:
I knew I had it right. "One good turn deserves
another." Give me the details on what happened.
Chinese:
果然是「與人方便，與己方便」嗎？
到底是什麼事，詳細情形說來聽聽……
Korean:
역시「인정을 베푸는 것은 남을 위한 게 아니다」로군
무슨 일이 있었는지, 자세히 들려 줘…
German:
Ich wusste es doch.
„Eine Hand wäscht die andere.“
Sag mir genau, was passiert ist.

English:
You should let Nokia do as she wishes. She's not
as thoughtless as she looks, or seems.
Chinese:
諾奇雅就放任她去做吧！
她不像言行與外表所見一樣隨便。
Korean:
노키아 군은 좋을 대로 하게 내버려 둬도 돼
그녀는 언행이나 겉보기만큼 경솔한 아이는 아닌 것 같으니 말이지
German:
Du solltest Nokia tun lassen, was sie möchte.
Sie ist nicht so unbedacht, wie man meinen
könnte.

English:
Her response clearly comes after a lot of careful
thought. We have no right to stand in her way.
Chinese:
我想這是她深思熟慮過後得出的答案，
我們沒有阻止她的權利。
Korean:
그녀 나름대로 심사숙고해서 낸 결론이겠지
우리들에게 그걸 막을 권리는 없어
German:
Ihre Reaktion hat sie sich offenbar gut überlegt.
Wir haben kein Recht, sie aufzuhalten.

English:
I think Arata's got the right idea about sneaking
into Kamishiro. Let's wait on him to form our 
strategy.
Chinese:
另外我贊成新說要潛入神代的提案，
我們就等他的作戰計畫出來吧！
Korean:
아라타 군의, 카미시로의 잠입에 관해서도 찬성이다
그의 작전 입안을 기다려 보자고
German:
Ich glaube, Arata hat schon den richtigen Ansatz,
wenn er sich bei Kamishiro einschleichen will.
Warten wir seine Strategie ab.

English:
Heehee...
Things have certainly gotten a bit more exciting,
haven't they?
Chinese:
呵呵呵……
看來我們身邊都開始有所行動了呢！
German:
Hihi ...
Die Lage ist brisanter geworden, nicht wahr?

English: You can't really help but get a rush from it!
Chinese: 這次的行動，真叫人緊張期待啊！
